result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny E Burks Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS WILL RESULT IN CIVIL JUDGMENT.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny E Burks Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO CHERYL B. OS

AS to each count in the amended information:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
AS TO EACH COUNT: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction; concurrent, credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2  YEARS, concurrent  with the following conditions:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS WILL RESULT IN CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions and payment of all financial obligations the court will order expungement pursuant to 973.015.

Defendant Johnny E Burks in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Johnny E Burks in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed by the state:  count 1: FLEEING(Misdemeanor)346.04(2t)
count 2: OBSTRUCTING an OFFICER, a class A misdemeanor, 946.41(1).
Motion to Dismiss received and filed.  State to file their response by October 12, 2015.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Johnny E Burks not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Court Trial.   Matter adjourned for a Motion to Dismiss.  Defendant is NOT to be produced from Lincoln Hills.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny E Burks in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Defense requests this matter be calendared for a non-evidentiary motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Order to Produce for Plea Hearing on August 10, 2015 @ 1:30 pm received and filed

Defendant Johnny E Burks in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however Branch 21 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnny E Burks in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in juvenile custody.  A depositional hearing to be held at the end of the month.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny E Burks in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Defendant has a dispositional hearing in Children's Court on May 29, 2015.   Parties informed the Court that how this case proceeds will be determined by what happens at the Children's Court hearing.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny E Burks in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No driving at all or a passenger in a car without permission from his parent, defendant is to cooperate with Tracking program and any orders of Children's Court, No disruptive behavior at home or in the community  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Johnny E Burks Jr
Current: 5331 North 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 04-21-2015)
Prior: 5331 North 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Patrick K., Jean M. and L.H. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Johnny E Burks in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on  4-21-2015 at 1:30pm
